Class Game

java.lang.Object
Game
public class Game extends Object
Main game model for the platformer.

Responsible for holding game state (player, enemies, bullets, map, camera), loading assets, and advancing the simulation each tick via update().

In the MVC refactor this class represents the "Model": it contains no rendering code and exposes getters for the View/Renderer to display the current state.

Author:
psyjr14

  • Method Details

    • getPlayer

      public Player getPlayer()
      Returns:
      the current player instance for the active run.

    • getEnemies

      public ArrayList<Enemy> getEnemies()
      Returns:
      mutable list of enemies currently active in the level.

    • getActiveBullets

      public ArrayList<Bullet> getActiveBullets()
      Returns:
      mutable list of bullets currently active in the level.

    • getInputHandler

      public InputHandler getInputHandler()
      Returns:
      input handler used to record and consume player input.

    • getAmmoBox

      public javafx.scene.image.Image getAmmoBox()
      Returns:
      HUD image used to draw an ammo icon.

      public javafx.scene.image.Image getHeart()
      Returns:
      HUD image used to draw a heart icon.

    • getKeysPressed

      public boolean[] getKeysPressed()
      Convenience accessor for movement keys recorded by InputHandler.
      Returns:
      boolean array representing current movement input state.

    • isLastDirectionForwards

      public boolean isLastDirectionForwards()
      Convenience accessor for the last horizontal direction pressed.
      Returns:
      true if last direction was right/forwards, false if left/backwards.

    • isWon

      public boolean isWon()
      Returns:
      true if the win condition has been reached for the current run.

    • getFont

      public javafx.scene.text.Font getFont()
      Returns:
      the loaded font used by the renderer/UI.

    • getCloud

      public javafx.scene.image.Image getCloud()
      Returns:
      the cloud image used for jump effects.

    • getCameraOffset

      public int getCameraOffset()
      Camera x-offset (in world pixels) used by the renderer to convert world coordinates into screen coordinates.
      Returns:
      current camera offset in pixels.

    • getMap

      public MapBlocks getMap()
      Returns:
      the current map model containing tile blocks and map width.

    • getDeathCounter

      public int getDeathCounter()
      Returns:
      number of player deaths/respawns in the current run.

    • incrementDeaths

      public void incrementDeaths()
      Increments the recorded death counter for the current run.

    • getBackground

      public Background getBackground()
      Returns:
      background model used for parallax rendering.

    • loadImages

      public void loadImages()

    • update

      public void update()
      Advances the game simulation by one tick.

      This method consumes one-shot inputs (jump/shoot/restart), updates the camera, updates the player and enemies, and steps bullets. It also handles win/death state transitions and respawning.

    • updateCamera

      public void updateCamera(int viewWidth)
      Updates the horizontal camera offset so the player stays centred where possible.

      The camera is clamped to the map bounds so it never scrolls past the level.

      Parameters:
      viewWidth - width of the visible viewport in pixels.

    • spawnEntities

      public void spawnEntities()
      Resets and spawns the player, enemies, and bullet list for a new run.

      This also resets the run start time and clears win state. Enemy spawn positions are currently hard-coded.

    • init

      public void init()
      Initialises the map and spawns entities for the first run.

      This should be called after loadImages() so that map tiles and sprites are already available.
